revised_title: Gleb Anrep: A Life of Science and Adventure
tldr: Gleb Anrep was a Russian scientist who made significant contributions to the field of physiology. Born into a family with a rich history of military and scientific achievements, Anrep studied at the Institute of Experimental Medicine in St. Petersburg under his father's guidance. He later moved to London and worked with Sir Starling at University College London. Anrep's career took him to Cambridge and eventually to Cairo, where he became a Professor of Physiology at Kasr el Aini. He was a skilled researcher, teacher, and lecturer, and made a lasting impact on the field of physiology.
